name: github_scenario_view_edit_the_requirement_document_in_the_canvas
description: Test case for: As a user I want to view/edit the requirement document in the canvas.

parts.text: view/edit the requirement document in the canvas.

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I can open and edit the requirements document in the Canvas as soon as we have a repository and branch set up. The choice below picks the project language and whether to use a Cyoda template (public) or your repo (private), and whether to create a new branch or use an existing one. Once you choose, I’ll proceed with the appropriate initialization steps and then we can load and edit the requirements in Canvas.

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]
